Dummy scopes for testing taskcluster components.

Everybody who wants to hack or test taskcluster should apply for access to the mozillians group [taskcluster-contributors](https://mozillians.org/en-US/group/taskcluster-contributors/)

Users with un-vouched Mozillians profiles (which is to say, just about anyone with an email address and a few minutes' work) get this group.  It should only have the scopes required to run the tutorial, and nothing that might harm other users of TaskCluster.

This role specifies scopes to be granted to all mozilla github repositories.

When authorizing a new github organization, you must create a role:
`assume:repo:github.com/<organization>/*` and assign it the scope:
`assume:github:mozilla-repository`.

This way all mozilla repositories will have the scopes granted to this role.

Base scopes for all aws-provisioner-provisioned worker types

This role was auto-generated by pmoore on 28 October 2016 to allow generic worker to access its own config, if its worker type is updated. It queries the provisioner to get the latest worker type definition, to establish if a new deployment is required, by checking the deploymentId field, and seeing if that is different to its current deploymentId. If it is, it will shut down.

Created by garndt

Created by pmoore. This worker type is used exclusively for running generic worker CI tests on Windows Server 2012 R2. It is like win2012r2 worker type, but runs tasks as admin (required by generic worker tests in order to be able to create task users). Max capacity set permanently low (ideally 1).
